Generations of unprocessed trauma has caused collective disconnection and dissociation. The traditional healthcare system forgot to include the body and spirit into the healing process. And many (most) spiritual lineages have bypassed the body and the reality of trauma. So I get why healing into wholeness is so confusing, hard, and misunderstood.

And today many of us are healing trauma and deconditioning societal programming during the age of social media. Which is a hot mess in itself. So much content and so little soul. Ai slop and hustle culture are now the norm on social media. We are more informed than we ever have been and more confused as byproduct. And that isn’t our fault.

Our bodies and spirits were not meant to consume this much information from strangers online at one time. Our minds and bodies have boundaries that are being bypassed each day by social media, hustle culture, and a meta-crisis that keeps us over-informed, hypervigalent, and apathetic. This is by design to keep us disempowered consumers.

The truth is that our bodies can only process so much. Even as a somatic practitioner, my body has limits and boundaries. The difference is today that I listen to my body and put my phone down. This has resulted in a lot more regulation, more energy to be creative and alive. Oh, and I don’t get involved in drama that isn’t mine. And I absolutely don’t follow masses hypnotized into collective insanity off a cliff. Instead I have recaptured my own attention, my own life force energy, and embody my divine empowerment.

And what is true for me is also true for you because we share the commonality of having a human nervous system. So me becoming more authentic and aligned by way of the truth of the wisdom of my body; isn’t a “me” thing. It is a human be-ing authentically human. Fully aligned. Fully empowered. And fully authentic.

Our human nervous systems and bodies are designed to function as coherent systems that can navigate the noise. When we are able to listen to the boundaries of our body-mind and our “No”, this invites more space inside ourselves so we might begin to live more of our “Yes.” And our “Yes” being more of our True Nature: which is coherent, wise, authentic, connected, curious, aligned, and so so much more.

The Radical Act of Humanizing Your Suffering

So what do we do? Well, we need to slow it down to start and be radically compassionate to ourselves. Of course we are suffering. Suffering is the greatest commonality of being human. To be human is to suffer. Start there. That is your mantra. “I suffer because all humans suffer.”

Next: know that living a soul-aligned life can be hard at first. All change is hard. Our minds and bodies want to keep the status quo. Even if the status quo is suffering. That is how trauma echos through the mind and body. Cultural conditioning may say “don’t rock the boat.”

It gets worse before it gets better. That is your next mantra: “It may get a bit worse before it gets a bit better.” Now, did you know that your body can start to shift by actually talking to it? Yes, that is true. And talking to it with Trauma-Informed language is what works the best.

Trauma-Informed language is the opposite of the “all or nothing” language of wellness influencers online. So please don’t buy into their “This is THE way to heal” or “Try this ONE thing to start living the life of your dreams.” That doesn’t work. You would not be reading this if it did.

Our bodies won’t be gaslit into change and transformation. Nor will our bodies accept BS and misinformation. At first of course, you may try and in the end what may happen is that something some influencer says online simply won’t work for you. Then trauma brain will tell you that is somehow your fault.

Because often Trauma Survivors have been gaslit so much that a part of us will start to gaslight ourselves. And this causes so much suffering and I truly am sorry that this is the social media landscape we are living in.

What I am here to tell you is that you are not broken and you are not “doing it wrong.” Simply, we may need to make wellness practices more trauma-informed for ourselves. A lot of times that may mean receiving individual trauma support. We also can understand what making trauma-informed practices for ourselves can look like, and that is what I am aiming to do here now.

What our body wants and needs is truth, in the form of Trauma-Informed language. Truth from a trauma-informed perspective, we can talk to ourselves in a better more trauma-informed way in which we can widen the Window of Tolerance of our nervous system a bit more each day.

There are many ways to do this - numerous in fact! And in this teaching, what we can start to do is to talk to our bodies in ways in which are realistic and attainable in nervous system terms (that is trauma-informed). We can do this by talking to our bodies in language of “a little bit more…” and and a “little bit less” of what you are integrating or learning about yourSelf.

Don’t take my word for it. Try it out yourself:

  • Notice your feet/seat on the ground

  • Come into noticing the room around you, 360 degrees, with softer eyes

  • Breathe and blink

  • Next say to yourSelf/your body: “I am whole” and notice.

  • Likely a part of your body contracted if you are a healing Trauma.

  • Now let’s try this trauma-informed edit: “I am becoming a little bit more whole”. Then notice. Likely less of your body contracted.

  • Notice the difference in the change of language from “whole” to “a little bit more whole.” That shift in language is what I am talking about. It makes a big difference when we talk to ourselves in more trauma-informed ways.

Cutting Through the Wellness Noise: Why the “One Simple Trick” is BS

Our world has woken up a bit to trauma but it is not yet Trauma-Informed fully. And our world is becoming spiritual but most spiritual teachers have not deconditioned their dogmatic programming of all epochs before. So there is a lot of misinformed yet well-intentioned information out there.

Another difficult part for so many healing is that healing into wholeness is very individual. There are some universal things that can happen, yet your trauma and journey is uniquely yours. And no one but you will truly understand what it is to be like you. And to make it even more complex, we can’t heal alone. We are interconnected beings meant to connect to one another and heal, together, collectively. The body is interconnected to all bodies and systems around it.

To simplify it: healing is unique to you, there can be universal elements, and healing will require individual pieces and collective community. Make sense? I know it all is confusing. I have spent several decades learning just to try to simplify it to make it understandable.

The Tightrope Walk: Why Healing Demands a Guide (Not a Guru)

And then it gets more difficult. Because to heal you must interrupt patterns, usually long-lasting patterns in your personal life story, your family’s patterns, and likely your culture.

The hard piece is that a traumatized nervous system comes with a bunch of trauma-responses and fragmented parts that want you to keep doing what you or your family or your culture has always done - because that is what is coded in your nervous system as “safe.”

So to heal is go to a place where you have never gone. And in a trauma-informed way, please do this within the window of your capacity. Not too much, not too little, and just right. And not too early or not too late but at the right time…or you may re-traumatize yourself and have new and additional traumas.

Again, the nuance needed to truly teach about trauma is one of a million reasons I am not still trying to teach you on tiny squares on Instagram.

To go to the authentic place in your being and in your patterns we must walk through the shadow, through the trauma, and to the next level of your potential. This is best done somatically so your mind and body gets used to the new patterns and starts to code the new patterns as “familiar.”

When healing is rushed, too fast, too much, too soon, or too late - well, we can prolong our suffering. And to walk a tightrope across a cliff to the next stage of your human and soul development to get more authentic and aligned - is best done with a light. A guide. Doing this in the dark is not recommended. Of course it can work. Yet the suffering can increase.

Grounded Spirituality IS Trauma-Informed (Everything Else Usually Just Bypasses)

My work and teachings include the love/light and depth/shadow. For this wholeness. And the Authentic Self includes it all. The soul doesn’t care about about a cute Instagram aesthetic. It doesn’t care about a linear story that ends with a cute bow. No, the soul is here to grow and does not give a damn about what society thinks.

This is why I provide somatic-spiritual trauma support. Because to level up the nervous system and spirit; is like a trust fall into the Universe. Because we have never known what living authentically is like! Trauma and social conditioning cause us to live automatically and unconsciously.

Our lives will shift greatly when we begin to interrupt the patterns that keep us in-authentic, mis-aligned, and suffering. This does not mean it is all sunshine and giggles. I love those stories and in those healing tales, most folks leave out the depth and shadow. Many folks never actually heal into wholeness and only share superficial successes. Again, the soul craves depth and full mind, body, and spiritual integration. Not vibes.

Until we start the healing process and then start to learn that the healing process is very deep, it can be spiritual, our shadow is a real thing, and holy sh*t - I just wanted to be more regulated?! I didn’t schedule a Dark Night of the Soul in my google calendar! And my burnout didn’t align with my vacation days.

The Discomfort Zone: Why 90% of People Stop Before the Breakthrough

To make this even more uncomfortable and well, hard - the people around us who are spiritually and emotionally immature are going to become more and more noticeable. And just noticing their immaturity may be a mismatch in your arising authenticity. And that can be messy. And oh, so very uncomfortable.

Now, authenticity for some can be the individuation process if they come from enmeshed families. So while authenticity can lead to embracing your new-found individual identity, there also needs to be a process back into inter-connection.

Otherwise, you may unconsciously harm those you love if your authenticity and becoming process is too long, too disruptive, and too messy. Again, this is one of the million reason why I also provide individualized trauma support. Because navigating this process does not come with a map. There are no books on your healing process - except the book you are co-authoring with the Universe.

Overall, the discomfort of becoming the authentic and aligned Whole Self is so hard and uncomfortable - that most folks will never do it. For those who have healed into wholeness, you know just how hard this all is.

Personally, I survived complex trauma and my healing process required decades of work. So if anything, my personal experience gave me the felt sense knowing of just how much our hearts may need to break, to open up into our authenticity. And this isn’t cute. Or easy. Or even understood by most people.

Also some folks may want to heal but will not have the potential to heal in this lifetime. Many empaths can get trapped by seeing someone’s potential - only for that potential to never be embodied in this lifetime. Empaths tend to see the field of ultimate potential.

The problem with this when it comes to love and relationships is that the field of potential is only that: potential. For potential to be realized it must be fully embodied. This will require deep change and pattern shifts to happen, likely over years and decades. And you cannot do that work for someone else.

For potential to be realized there needs to be capacity. And some folks do not have the capacity…yet. It may require lifetimes of inner work. This may result in empaths waiting an entire life for someone to heal, who cannot heal, and never accept the person in front of them as they are. The best piece of truth I can offer here is that you can love someone and you may not be able to live with them or build an aligned life with them.

Others will choose comfort and “keeping the peace” at all costs. Even at the cost of their own health. Even at the cost of their own mind. Even the cost of living someone else’s life and not living as their True Self.

The other elephant in the room that I see and many don’t notice (yet) is the fact that at this point, you are likely working through eons of unprocessed inter-generational and collective cultural trauma, on top of your childhood trauma. The patterns of protection may be programmed so deeply that they look like “just how your family is” or “that is just how things are” or even as an entire culture.

Hustle Culture and Over-Helping: When Collective Insanity Becomes Normalized

Look at the western world - so many horrible things are “normalized” that create so much suffering for so many. Yet they are allowed to happen. In many families, communities, and even workplaces - things like hustle culture and over-helping are encouraged. Due to eons of unprocessed ancestral and collective trauma - it is now some badge of honor to be “busy.” How insane is that?

Working mothers are drowning and making less than their male peers in the west. It is 2025 and we there are still arguments about basic human rights. We have witnessed predator after predator be protected; while children continue to be harmed. This is what has been normalized. Yet this isn’t normal. This is a collective dissociation. Collective insanity is when insane things are normalized.

So yes, I get how healing into wholeness and then finding yourself spiritual awakening during the process can come with heaping amounts of discomfort. To make it even harder, healing is messy and more confusingly, it isn’t linear. We have influencers telling complex trauma survivors to “just do a cold plunge” and everything will be okay. Or you are just one $10,000 wellness retreat away from living the life of your dreams!

I don’t buy it and neither do you. Or maybe you bought it for some time and are curious if there is another way. Or maybe you tried so many things and are just as confused and frustrated as when you started. Or maybe you did go on the retreat and learned something but there is more you desire. Well good, then you found yourself some nuanced information about the uncomfortable realities that is healing into wholeness right here.

I understand the madness, I was once in your shoes. And that is why I continue to show up and teach on the hot mess that is the internet these days. Although, lately, I choose to teach only to those of you right here who are consenting to what I have to say - versus the wild west that is the rest of social media.

The Soul Can’t Be Selfied (Influencers Be Damned)

The soul absolutely does not give a sh*t about making the wholeness process Instagrammable. Influencers, be damned. And for anyone who has earnestly worked for their wholeness, you know that our Whole Self includes the light and the shadow.

Many folks find themselves seeking spiritual solutions when the ways of this insane world insults their soul. And then we find out to our dismay that much of the spiritual community has bypassed the body and pushes you to dissociate or gaslight yourself.

Spiritual cosplay is running rampant in a conditioned society that had repressed authentic expression. Look at any wellness retreat group photo in the past couple of years in the USA. Everyone is wearing the same f*cking hat. The same spiritual garb. “Look at me, I am spiritual - see I have the spiritual hat!”

True grounded and integrated spirituality is about being fully alive. Not about any practice or outfit you are wearing. Enlightened beings don’t announce themselves. They simply are living out their enlightenment as a human be-ing. Enlightened humans eat, they laugh, they cry, and they poop.

Enlightenment is for everyone. The biggest secret that most don’t know? The Authentic Self is the Enlightened Self - interconnected with every Authentic Self and SELF. And when we forget we are enlightened, we simply can remember. Over and over again. It is this simple. You don’t need to buy a hat to embody your soul.

You Are Not Broken: What is Broken is the System

Now spirituality can come with a lot of baggage in itself. Because of eons of religious and spiritual trauma. And for a complex trauma survivor or someone who is neurodivergent - wellness and spiritual solutions may be dysregulating.

Or re-traumatizing. Or perhaps even worse: perpetuate the story that since the spiritual path isn’t working for you then the unconscious belief may be that “I must be broken.” And you my dear, are not broken. Our systems of society are what is broken.

Collective insanity has created a collective dissociation at all levels of our society and this is rippling down into us. Sick systems gaslight us that we are a perpetual problem - to be fixed. By of course, some expert outside of us.

And often we have been conditioned to believe we are the problem. So often when we reach out for heal to to be labeled and pathologized as dysfunctional. How insane is that? We live in a society that treats the human condition and our collective spiritual crisis as an individual pathology?!

But you are not broken. What is broken is our collective spirit. What is broken is the USA healthcare system. What is broken is spirituality that doesn’t include the human nervous system that is traumatized. In my lived experience and in my work - the only way to wholeness is to not pathologize trauma responses or to spiritually bypass the human condition.

Pathologizing trauma and spiritually bypassing the human are the two collective distortions that are causing so much harm in the healthcare and spiritual fields. And many of us have had our trauma responses labeled as “disordered”.

And many of us have lived through gate-keeping of spirituality in our lifetimes. And many of us can sense even into our bones all of the spiritual and religious trauma that our ancestors survived as well.

You Are Your Own Guru, Boo: Embracing Spiritual Sovereignty

As someone who survived both complex trauma, pervasive child abuse, neglect, and a religious Christian cult; I understand how important it is for me to not be perceived as a gatekeeper or dogmatic. I am not someone who follows any one path.

Also my definition of spirituality currently is “purpose and meaning”, “Divine Intelligence”, and “An Energy of Love that Interconnects Us All.” Which is why I leave your spirituality to be defined by you and you alone. Spiritual sovereignty is what I am all about. No gatekeepers, no gurus. You are your own, Guru, Boo.

To speak of the spiritual, I do need to use words - to explain things beyond the logical mind. Which is ridiculous all in itself, because this is a written teaching. So please know I am not a spiritual guru or attempting to play one on the internet. I, like many of you am a fellow seeker and a short-term guide back to your own inner authority: Your Authentic Self.

What I can say is that I am a life-long seeker who has has multiple direct mystical experiences. I have studied every type of religion for over four decades and for myself, embrace what I call “spiritual tapas”: a little bit of this and a little bit of that. And this is what lines up with my direct experiences and multicultural ancestry.

My ancestry is expansive and I am multicultural and embrace it all. My mystical experiences were in various different traditions - ancestral remembrances, past/parallel lives, multiple near death experiences, and a spontaneous soul retrieval, to name a few.

Somatic, shamanic, and energy practices opened up my intuition beyond my logic and spiritual inner knowing started to emerge as I healed into wholeness. This is an archetypal process of the human spirit. And it is not often talked about and so this is why I am still online teaching after all these years.

So if you are looking for a dogmatic teacher - she is not me. I am very open, extremely curious, and what I do know for sure: is that all paths that seekers earnestly go on, can and do lead Home. My psychopomp work of bridging souls stuck on this plane into their next stage of spiritual learning helps to confirm some of what my body ancestrally knows.

My goal is simple here in my teachings, to be a light in the dark to remind you that we have a mind, body, spirit, and energy. And when our soul suffers, then our mind and body can speak in wordless whispers, through symptoms. We can learn how to listen better and use our body and energy as a guide back to embodying more of our soul.

Authenticity is how I am teaching what enlightenment actually is when it is embodied. I came here to teach humanity how to heal. That was what my near death experience was about. It also was why I pervasively suffered and then remembered who I am and who we all are. All the training I took over the couple of decades were lessons on how to truly serve humanity.

Thank you for being here. I am only a short-term sherpa on the path to embodying more of your enlightenment/authenticity. You are your own Guru, Boo.

Practice Time: Retraining Your Nervous System with Trauma-Informed Language

A Trauma-Informed Spiritual-Somatic Practice for this week:

This week we are going to practice talking to ourSelves/bodies in a Trauma-Informed way. Why are we talking to ourselves and our bodies? Because we are re-training the voice of the Authentic Self.

We are becoming the nurturing, compassionate, present, wise observer of all the trauma responses, parts, and wounded inner child(ren.) This Authentic Self voice can and be reformed from the inside out, with practice.

I cannot even begin to describe how much my wounded inner child(ren) love to hear the wise leadership of the Authentic Self. At one point, all I could hear was traumatized parts and inner critics. It has been beyond words to witness my former inner critic willingly turn into an inner compassionate coach. Again, what is true for me is true for you as I have witnessed the same process unfold for thousands of clients I have worked with over the years.

These practices changed my entire life, health, and authentic expression in the world and I will teach until my very last breath. Because these somatic-spiritual practices saved my life and welcomed my soul to express fully as the Authentic Self.

Remember that practice from earlier in this teaching? We are just going to expand on that. That is how spiritual-somatic practices start to increase the regulation in our bodies and invite our authenticity to turn up a little bit - repetition and practice.

Healing and wholeness is a practice.

Let’s Begin:

Whatever word, thought, or feeling, the idea of “authenticity” brings up in you: maybe it is being transparent, being creative, being curious, or compassionate. Start there with that word/thought/feeling. I will use the word “creative” for the sample practice below.

  • Notice your feet/seat on the ground.

  • Come into noticing the room around you, 360 degrees, with softer eyes.

  • Breathe and blink.

  • Now let’s try this trauma-informed mantra: “I am becoming a little bit more creative.”

  • Then notice.

  • How does your mind expand when you think/feel that mantra? Does a vision or thought pop into your head? What is the energy of that? (Yes, inner critic parts may pop up with something critical to say and that is natural. Both the Authentic Self and inner critics can be present and you can kindly say back to your inner critic: “thank you for keeping me safe, I am practicing noticing the energy of a little bit more creativity.” Then notice again what it is like to think/notice the energy of being a little bit creative.

  • How does your body expand when you feel/sense that mantra? Which parts of the body open up a bit more? What is that like? (Yes, protective parts may contract in the body and that is natural. Both the Authentic Self and parts can be present. And you can kindly say back to that part of your body “thank you for keep me safe, I am practicing noticing what it feels like to notice what becoming a little bit more creative feels like.” Then once again notice what creativity feels like.

Congrats! This is somatic-spiritual practice is starting to reshape your nervous system a little bit through two rounds of nervous system retraining!

To be more fully human; follow my writings, practices, and love notes to humanity right here.

The authenticity in me, honors the authenticity arising in you,

-Shannon

items.content:
To change and show up more as our Authentic Selves is to often be uncertain, uncomfortable, and misunderstood. Personally, to listen to my “No” I had to grieve a whole lot. And by doing that I also grew. Both of these states were happening at the same time. That is okay as that is how wholeness works.

The hard part about authenticity is that it often is uncomfortable…at first. Later on and looking back, it is entirely worth it. Yet, it is a journey to arrive embodied in our Authentic True Selves. We carry multitudes in our authenticity. The light and the shadow. The shadow when integrated, brings more untapped wisdom to the table of our Whole Self.

Somatics Science Spirit is a reader-supported publication. To receive new posts and support my work, consider becoming a free or paid subscriber.

Authenticity requires radical honesty with ourselves. And our body and mind may be saying “No” in the only ways that they can speak; through difficult thoughts and symptoms. This is what is often misunderstood by many healthcare practitioners that aren’t trauma-informed or spiritually inclusive. And again, if we only listen to the status quo; we will get what we have always gotten - the same.

Authenticity Asks Us to Be Courageous

My entire career has been about integrating identities to become more and more whole and authentic. All parts loved tenderly into the mosaic of the Authentic Self. All the roles I played, were simply lessons on becoming true to mySelf.

I wasn’t a “business executive” - I was learning about business.

I wasn’t a University professor, I was learning how to teach.

I wasn’t a researcher - I was learning about how to translate data into a story.

I wasn’t a “rehabilitation counselor” - I was learning how to be with people suffering.

I wasn’t a “small business owner - I was learning to serve my community.

I am not a “Somatic Experiencing Probationer” - I was learning about the wisdom of the body.

I am not an “Energy Worker” - I was learning to translate energy to words.

I am not a “Shamanic Apprentice” - I am learning to bridge the seen and unseen.

I am not a “Trauma Expert” - I am learning to cause less harm when being with people.

This is what I was learning in the roles I was playing and with integration, I no longer identify with the roles as if the role is all I am. I play these roles and I am all of them, none of them, and so much more. My work as The Integrative Practitioner is symbolic of the integration of all roles and identities. Because my only true identification is the embodied spiritual being beyond all roles and identities…This is the Authentic Self.

The western world is highly traumatized and conditioned and only allows a superficial self to be seen, rewarded and accepted. Simply we must be someone, we must be our roles, or we must be our professions in order to be accepted into society and matter.

This however, is not the truth of our existence. When we emotionally and spiritually mature beyond a society that has never been allowed to be their Authentic Selves - we begin to see through this illusion. And to see through the illusion is not to abandon any role or identity we accidentally unconsciously played and were merged with for a false sense of security.

No, we must integrate all roles and all identities and radically and compassionately love ourselves into becoming the most authentic versions of ourselves. The True Self that sees all the roles and versions of us as a process of becoming.

This my dears, requires courage. And it will break your ego into dust. You will not make superficial people happy in the process. You may not be understood at family holiday gathering. Some of your friends may have concerns. Your colleagues may avoid you like the plague. This is how disruptive the Authentic Self is to an emotionally and spiritually immature society. Authenticity terrifies the ego.

Being Misunderstood Liberates the Authentic Self

My colleague and friend Ralph, who recently crossed over to what is next for their spirit, was a wise trauma therapist and meditation teacher. These are the roles they played and yet wasn’t identified with as they truly understood authenticity. And they would always say “the doors to the cage aren’t locked.”

Ralph lived this teaching. This is a metaphor of the conditioned self trapped in a cage of societal constructs that causes suffering. And only the Authentic Self can free the conditioned false self. All of this was contained in that small one phrase teaching. This is how a true master teacher serves humanity.

To be authentic is to not be understood by the masses who are hypnotized with the illusion of “success” or “being someone.” I’ve been lucky to work with successful people for decades. Some folks seemingly “have it all.”

And it is only when you reach the mountaintop of what you think you needed to have to become successful: the next degree, the car, the relationship, the certification, the business, the money, etc…that a spiritual crisis may emerge.

Because for the Authentic Soul, superficial things are not going to touch the depth of our hearts and souls. And waking up to this often is through a crisis, breakdown, or Dark Night of the Soul.

Superficial folks around you will not understand why you are not happy, not fulfilled, and not okay. “But you have it all?!” they will say. Well indeed you do have it all…materially. Yet we can be materially fulfilled and emotionally and spiritually bankrupt.

Those career labels I told you about before? Well, I suffered burnout in half of them. Why? Because my soul and Authentic Self was not aligned and seemed to be allergic to superficial stuff. My soul could literally give a sh*t about some certification, she came here to learn. So burnout was a symbol and a metaphor.

Also this is what the physical body does when we cross our unspoken needs, wants, and desires. The deepest parts of me - the WISE and TRUE aspects of mySelf were crying out to be heard. And my wise body slowed everything down into survival mode until the soul was allowed to shine through.

As a complex Trauma survivor myself, I do want to be clear here that this needed to happen. There was no other way for me to listen to the wordless cries of my soul. Complex Trauma can cause our Authentic Self to nearly drown in the sea of fragmented parts that needed to do whatever we needed to do to survive, be seen, and be understood.

The burnout that occurred in my body is also something that can happen universally when our traumatized parts try and silence our Authentic Self. So many of us trauma survivors and neurodivergent humans have to become someone at the superficial level in order to put the puzzle pieces of our soul back together. And that superficial someone may end up totally burnt out because our soul has been suppressed in the process.

So the Dark Night of Soul occurs. And this goes on for as long as needed until Authenticity is fully loaded. It can even happen multiple times if we have really stubborn parts or need to level up even after we think we went fully authentic. Because our authentic self can widen and expand beyond what our conditioned mind can even comprehend.

This is where a “healing journey” may start or when you start reading spiritual books or get interested in alternative practices, the “woo” and stuff that may weird parts of you or those who know you out. I call this a “Soul Recon Mission” and it is okay. This is natural to the human spirit.

And I want you to know that you cannot get your process wrong. At all. Whatever happens outwardly is the inner movement of the soul. Of course you can take some wrong turns that can absolutely cause a lot of suffering and this is why trauma-spiritual support are helpful.

Yet the outward process is still symbolic and a metaphorical one. And your process is your process. It is not easy, it is often messy, and it is definitely uncomfortable. Can you absolutely go through multiple periods of burnout and Dark Nights of the Soul - Yes. Can support also be helpful - Yes. Is all of this worth it - You can only say Yes, on the other side of it all.

Personally, my process to becoming an integrative practitioner was difficult and beautiful. Decades of inner work allowed me the time and space to integrate all dimensions of my being into my Whole Self. You cannot even imagine how misunderstood this process has been personally and professionally.

It is wild to me when folks reach out because they are inspired or want to become like me. And I also understand it. Many perceive that life is easy when you are authentic or work authentically. No, this could not be further from the truth.

To live and work authentically is to disrupt the status quo. And the status quo wants to remain the same. If threatened with authenticity, the status quo can be quite aggressive. Why? Societal conformity is riddled with unprocessed inter-generational pain, collective trauma, and conditioned beliefs that are passing off as a: culture, field, group, workplace, family, or system looking like “that’s just the way things are.” Classic denial and dissociation at the collective level. Authenticity requires honesty, truth, and embodied wisdom. The collective unconscious has not yet earned wisdom or known the wholeness that is the Authentic Self.

Professionally, I have been misunderstood at all levels. Bullied, harassed, and treated like the next guru. Again thankfully to earned inner wisdom, wise ancestors that were searched for in earnest, and deep/consistent inner work, I know I am not the projections that someone casts upon me from their screen of their consciousness.

To have done the inner work and met, included, transmuted, and embraced all aspects of myself is to truly know thyself. This is not a humble brag either. This is permission from me to you to discover who you truly are. Because at the deepest level, I am you and you are me. What is possible for me is possible for you too.

So when I am harassed online by some healthcare practitioner who isn’t trauma-informed and doesn’t embrace the spiritual dimensions of being human - I know that is their stuff, not mine. Because to include someone’s mind, body, spirit, and energy in their hopes, dreams, and goals just makes sense to me. Yet to western traditional healthcare when I first talked about these things…let’s just say it wasn’t well received by everyone.

Yet my soul knew to follow the inner wisdom of my Authentic Self. I can’t imagine how sick I would have become if I kept squashing my authenticity into a suffocating box of conformity. Being near death at the time of my decision to go fully authentic; I can tell you that it was a great choice of the soul. The risk was worth the reward.

And if you think for one second the reward is “vibing high all of the time” - that too is an illusion of the idea of the Authentic Self. The reward also includes feeling every single emotion possible; and yet not getting lost or grasping onto any of them as they are me.

Emotions are passing through me. I am witnessing emotion in the field of my soma and awareness. Because to be human and authentic is to be fully alive. And to be fully alive is to sense fully with the mind, body, and spirit.

Who I know myself to really be is the one who witnesses all the waves in the ocean of my being. So don’t get it twisted; being authentic is not to be confused with “positive vibes only” That is a dissociated spiritually immature trope to get you to deny your body and live only in the spiritual realms where we have less power to make real 3D changes to our lives and the in the lives of others.

Yet we are less powerful if we are only in the spiritual. The seat of the greatest untapped power is the body, the bridge from the spiritual to the physical. Where we bring our visions into reality. Where we are most empowered is being interconnected to all levels of our being: mind, body, spirit, and energy. This process I call “integration.”

You’re Earning Wisdom

The secret that the western world does not want us to know is how truly powerful we really are. We are not dis-empowered beings that need to look outward at emotionally immature leaders or a spiritually bankrupt society for permission to exist, belong, and matter. Yes, that is what many of the “perceived powers that be” want us to believe. And why is that?

It is because if they keep us fearful of who we actually are: empowered co-creators, they can continue to attempt to control us and make us hate one another. Hate anyone who is “different” and doesn’t conform to their collective insanity.

The western world attempts to function off of dominating the self and other. Yet indigenous wisdom and ancestral ways of being prove that we are interconnected and highly relational beings. Within each of us is a mind, body, spirit, and energy that picks up on these dimensions of being in others and the natural world.

When when understand ourselves to be more than just a solid material self that is to be controlled and dominated; this process invites a curiosity into the deepest existential question one can ask: “Who am I? This is a natural process of maturing as an adult and coming into our Meta-cognition of being aware of being aware.

In midlife, it is natural to get curious and to begin to deconstruct what we have been told we are and to begin to heal and become who we truly are. Unfortunately, due to the colonization of the mind and body by the western world; the sacred transition in midlife to become authentic is often disrupted, misunderstood, and because most of society is highly traumatized…the transition into midlife can be a messy crisis. This is another spiritual awakening point however, if you turn inward (and possibly get support.)

Yet many are awakening to this sacred transformative initiation into being an emotionally and spiritually mature adult. To truly heal and awaking is to earn spiritual and emotional power.

This empowerment is earned wisdom. This wisdom is who we are at our core and an ancestral urge within. These are the energies once somatically embodied, create the wise elder within.

The Body is Our Sacred Compass

When we begin to heal and awaken within, we can start to see that our Authentic Self has an inner compass. We are wise, we have morals, and inner ethics that can guide us more and more towards our authenticity.

We may even evolve past the point of needing or even wanting spiritual gatekeepers to our True Authentic Selves. Because our Authentic Self is a Wise Self Leader. This inner leader doesn’t look outward to a false sense of authority - this energy within us is our soul. The soul being part The One who can detect the True Self in another.

And our Authentic Self, the bridge to our soul and spirit can detect the realness of Self or the fake conditioned false self in another. I refer to this process that unfolds into realizing more and more truth as: discernment.

In my own inner work and in what I teach my clients and those I mentor; we don’t need divination tools or oracle decks to discern the real and false self of another. We can use our own bodies as our sacred inner compass. Divination tools of course are fun and can be a tool - and these tools eventually will only confirm what your body knows once wholeness starts to arrive on the scene.

And I cannot even begin to tell you just how much partnering with your body can help you trust yourSelf more. You can also begin to trust others in a whole different way. Along with trusting the Universe at a level of being an empowered co-creator.

Healing into wholeness isn’t for the faint of heart. Because you will also see just how much many people’s words don’t reflect their actions or energy. You begin to see that many around us may be growing older and not wiser. We are living in a society that many adults are wounded children trapped in aging bodies. Many in “leadership positions” are those who perform and conform the most in an unwell society and definitely are not authentic.

This is why healing, waking up, and becoming whole is often subconsciously avoided by many - because it truly can destroy many of our illusions. Yet, once those illusions are grieved - a life of magic, wonder, flow, creativity, curiosity, connection, compassion, and authenticity awaits on the other side of your inner process.

Once we are whole, we aren’t waiting for anyone to save us. We become the one we have been waiting for. And once we heal past becoming who we needed - we can become who we truly are. This is the Authentic Self.

A Somatic Trauma-Informed Prompt to Embody 1% More Authenticity This Week:

  • Remember a day in the recent past when you felt a little more like yourself; freer, more honest, more alive. Even just a little bit more like who you are becoming.

  • As you recall it, what sensations arise in your body right now? Maybe it isn’t your body that is remembering, but your mind - what visions or thoughts are you noticing?

  • If it is your body remembering; Where do you feel warmth, openness, or ease?

  • If it is your mind recalling; What words or meaning come up?

  • What shifts in sided your body or mind when you imagine letting that version of you breathe in this moment a little more?

  • You are invited to come back to this prompt once or twice a day in the morning and evening and practice this week. Notice what shifts. Journal about it, voice note yourself and listen to it back, tell someone you trust what you are noticing, or even reply in the comments.

To be more fully human; follow my writings, practices, and love notes to humanity right here.

The authenticity in me, honors the authenticity arising in you,

-Shannon

items.title: Radical Authenticity: Why I Quit Performing Wellness
items.author: Shannon Myers, MS, SEP
items.description: On leaving toxic platforms, unmasking the Authentic Self, and the revolutionary act of listening to your body’s "No."
items.content:
After decades of personally processing complex Trauma and spiritual seeking: I am happy to report that I have found and embodied my Authentic Self. This homecoming came with much growth, expansion, and highlighted areas of my life and small business that were out of alignment with who I really am.

My body of course was having a visceral reaction to the misalignment in the form of burnout. And this realization invited a chance to make changes. We have hundreds of choice points each day both big and small that can add up to life transformation. So of course I chose to make choice in favor of my authenticity or conforming and shrinking.

And I have so much love and compassion for the prior selves that brought me to this realization. Because I couldn’t have become who I really am without all of versions of me that tried so hard and hustled. Capitalism is a sick system that requires us to obediently comply. So I did what capitalism said I needed to be in order to “be someone.” As I result, I worked until I burnt out. In multiple careers.

Burnout can bring a lot of clarity though and reminds us where we may have crossed our own inner boundaries. Especially boundaries that were not yet revealed to us. Those unexpressed boundaries speak in symptoms and relationship issues. That is the thing about boundaries; many of the boundaries that would be absolutely life changing don’t come through words or thoughts but rather as embodied soul manifestations in the mind, body, and relationship fields.

We also may have deeply ingrained unconscious patterns that can keep our best boundaries hidden, even to us. And that is the truest thing for those of us with a complex Trauma history: we have to cross our own boundaries to appease those in our lives harming us.

Safety makes us contract and dissociate from our own needs in order to appease the other. Safety isn’t expansive. Safety is a state of contraction to preserve our precious life force energy. So our body and mind continues to pay high costs in order to survive dysfunction.

So we appease and people please even unconsciously. Western society is as dysfunctional as the most dysfunctional family. And this dysfunctional broken system that we call society, then rewards us when we hustle and caretake others, even at our own demise.

The toxic western world asks us to perform like “good business owners” and diligently post on social media - until a personal or collective soul crisis calls us inward to reflect. Burnout is a sacred messenger. Each cycle of burnout as neurodivergent humans and Trauma Survivors invites us to get bolder each time in terms of loving ourselves and accommodating our needs.

Eventually, we wake up and reclaim our True Nature. I say this as if it happens overnight. It doesn’t! This journey of reclaiming my authenticity took decades of inner and outer work for me to write these words to you. As well as multiple burnouts.

What I have learned on my own journey is nearly universal to the story of the thousands of others I have guided in their journeys. To be our Authentic Selves; is to embody more and more of our wholeness. And the ways in which we are living and working that are out of alignment, may not fit anymore when wholeness begins to load and cross the threshold.

Imagine the authenticity process like a cell phone battery. When our wholeness is more than 51% loaded, then we start to feel safer to be who we actually are, not continue to play the roles forced upon us to survive. This is okay and natural to becoming an emotionally and spiritually mature adult. It’s also quite literally what mid-life is all about.

Wholeness is Radically Liberating

One of the core wounds of many complex Trauma survivors is not feeling like we belong. Or belonging only at a superficial level of conditional love. Conditional love is a very narrow frequency and depends on how compliant, how “good”, and selfless we can be.

Hello, perfectionism and performing! We also can get a false sense of belonging for how we can help others by sacrificing our own needs for others. Over-helping sadly is a common complex Trauma archetype. The Wounded Healer.

However, authenticity is very different than the lies of our wounds. The limiting belief that we are only worth what we can produce, or how much we can help, or by posting on social media several times a day until our lives fall apart - are traps set by capitalism to fill the void that complex Trauma has created. And if don’t go inward, we can falsely assume that when capitalism burns us out, that we are somehow at fault.

Yet trauma is not just individual, it is also collective. Trauma can force us to hold onto for dear life to any sense of belonging in order to matter. Our wounded inner children fear that to not matter or not belong is be annihilated.

And capitalism and hustle culture lies to us that if we continue to deplete our life force energy and simply try harder - the next certification, posting three times a day, and market, market, market…that we will feel like we are enough.

Unprocessed Trauma Shows Up at Work

Western society and therefore many of the ways in which we are taught to be a successful business owner - naturally overrides our boundaries. To become authentic in service is to enter a Dark Night of the Soul to save yourself from a career of burnout disguised as “being a successful business owner.”

Especially for the sensitive neurodivergent soul and Trauma Survivor. We pick up on everything. Every glance, every voice shift, and even the subtle energy bodies present in the room. And without boundaries we are just as enmeshed in our work as we were in our family of origin in order to survive.

The individuation process is not just for your personal life, but also in your work life. Otherwise you will form your small business as a collection of Trauma Responses. To become aligned and authentic is to dive deep into your unconscious patterns in all areas of life.

Even and especially the areas in which we are “successful” in the eyes of a dysfunctional culture. What you find may break your heart and free your soul.

You may learn that Capitalism insults the soul. The soul knows what is really real and true. And it isn’t in the perfect curated online presence. We matter because all of life matters to Life itSELF.

In my last Substack teaching, I shared how we belong simply by existing. And how to embody more of our Authentic Self is to enliven our soul in human form. Making authenticity a radical act of healing, leading to wholeness, and eventual inner liberation. (If you missed that teaching you may find it here: Authenticity After Trauma: Reclaiming Your True Self)

In a world that so often asks us to perform, conform, and shrink ourselves to fit into boxes never made for us; authenticity is like a healing salve for the wounded parts of us who needed to people-please, shapeshift, and mask in order to stay safe to have a superficial level of belonging, conditional love, and a false sense of mattering.

The Cost of Masking

For those of us healing from trauma or living with neurodivergence, the pressure to mask our True Selves can run deep. We can burnout, end up with health conditions, and our relationships may suffer (to name a few.) Masking in itself tells us we are stressed and don’t feel safe.

It could be because of old Trauma surfacing or new stress happening. In either case, the mask is a performance. Masking our authenticity is a core pattern of unprocessed Trauma and unexamined social conditioning. Sadly, this means that we can have a superficial feelings of “safety” when we mask.

Yet to our soul this can feel like suffocation. Healing into wholeness calls us beyond surface level faking-it-until-we-make-it vibes. Because wholeness is a call to become our True Nature and embody more and more of our Authentic Selves. This is why healing into wholeness naturally can lead to an awakening of sorts. Reclaiming of more of our voice, more of our body, and more of our full presence.

Coming Home to My Authentic Self

This past year, I have gotten off social media except for when making more long-from creative content and sharing information about my offerings. My body was saying “No” to being forced to perform online for the appeasement of algorithms. In the process of uncovering how I truly want to teach; I returned to my inner wisdom and inner knowing.

This knowing did not come suddenly; it came after many years of deep frustration of trying to cut through the noise, distraction, and division that social media algorithms run off of. The periods of burnout were the sacred wisdom that parts of myself had crossed the boundaries of my True Self.

Trauma healing can be so very nuanced. As much of western society is highly traumatized and conditioned - there is a lot of terrible marketing advice out there. Had I kept following what capitalism said, I may have never uncovered what my True Self was craving. Luckily, the soul knows and in my process of being more authentic in my life and work; more creativity and aliveness arose in my nervous system and spirit.

Collective Dysregulation

The energy on social media is often gross and dysregulating. Being an energetic and somatic practitioner often what I was witnessing when on social media was a sanitized version of wellness or “healing.” It wasn’t realistic and it didn’t land in my nervous system as nourishing. It felt fake and lacking nuance.

I saw how dysregulated most wellness influencers were. As well as, how they were trying to dominate and control their own bodies. So I took a break to reflect. In the end, I embodied the answer: to be real and nuanced with you here and now.

Much of what is considered “content” is emotionally and spiritually immature. Our nervous systems aren’t meant for “hot takes” and “rage bait.” We are meant for true connection with ourselves, others, and Great Spirit. Not whatever is happening online these days. Seriously, what is even happening online?

The other area of frustration was that what I found on social media isn’t trauma-informed and doesn’t integrate the spiritual and deeper levels of being. And again, I want to be the answer to my own questions so I am providing more nuances trauma-informed AND spiritual education here. Where I can educate without character limits.

So of course it did not feel authentic for me to continue to contribute to hustle culture online! Most social media platforms aren’t made for humans to be authentic! So, why would I try and make myself fit into platforms that don’t honor and celebrate our multidimensional authentic selves?

Also, I didn’t go through several Dark Nights of the Soul to have to be fake, put on an act, or appease algorithms that doesn’t have my personal interests or our collective soul in mind. So I have chosen to show up to places where I can shift the culture and not continue the status quo.

Because authenticity requires reciprocity. That is what our bodies need. We don’t have a nervous system designed to consume short-form content that feeds of dysregulation. We are meant to be in relationship with one another and commune together. This is the opposite of most social media platforms.

Wellness Being Performed

Simply what I was witnessing at the collective level was wellness being performed online. Rarely is wellness done well…well. And I get it, nuance isn’t profitable as the algorithms have shorted our attention spans into doom scrolling being the default. Because capitalism runs off hustling until we break so that a few folks make money and the rest of us stay in loops of trauma re-enactments.

In a world where the algorithms are making our data and energy the product; I was wasting my precious life force trying to change a sick social media system. Instead, these days, I am choosing to create nuanced writings and teachings on Substack and YouTube as gifts to humanity. I hope to also bring back some small group teachings and practices as well in the near future.

My social media strategy, if I have one beyond authenticity, is sharing on social media longer form teachings. Nuanced. Multi-dimensional mind, body, spirit, and energy education. And teaching as a regulated emotionally and spiritually mature adult. That is what I am about.

And I am here for those who are aligned. Because we aren’t meant to make everyone happy. We are here to be fully human, alive, and embracing all aspects of our True Selves in relationship to those who are doing the same.

What I know for sure in this shift is that my well ancestors are proud. Having a soul-aligned life and service to humanity that welcomes our authenticity is our True Nature. Coherence is what we are about.

Since I have a choice to how I show up online, I am choosing authenticity. Not the fake post three-times-a-day until we burnout only for authentic content not to be shown since it doesn’t rage bait viewers into fear loops. So no, hard pass on whatever capitalism is offering as a marketing strategy. I am going with my souls inner knowing and ancestral wisdom, thank you very much.

From Should to Wants

My process is universal. I have had the privilege to work with thousands of others healing, dealing, and feeling. And a return to our soul, ancestral wisdom, and soma as is who we authentically are. We are creative beings that go through rhythms of creation, rest, and integration.

Hustle culture is not a rhythm that leads to wholeness. It is a dysfunctional collective trauma response that results in depletion of life force energy. As multidimensional beings who crave depth, connection, and creativity - continuing to follow the masses off a cliff of dysregulated insanity naturally no longer was aligned with the best interests of my nervous system or our collective body.

Forcing ourselves to show up in any area of life because that is what we “should” be doing is often either a trauma response or a conditioned unconscious pattern to attempt fit in a society that is toxic. When we heal, we start moving from doing what we need to do to survive - to beginning to start choosing what we want to do. And who we want to become. What many wellness accounts online misunderstand entirely is that Wholeness isn’t just being the person you needed when you were growing up; it is becoming who you actually are.

Authenticity Influences

Our body says “No” in a multitude of ways and I love Somatic Experiencing©, energy, and ancestral wisdom practices to learn how to listen. Because if it wasn’t for the inner knowing of my body and spirit; I might still be crossing my own boundaries and continuing to post on toxic social media platforms because “that is what good small business owners should do.” And likely I would not be experiencing the pure joy that I receive when I write for myself and you. There is something beyond should; and it is what our authenticity requires. That something? Authentic inner knowing. And being received by those who welcome your unique soul signature in the world.

And who you actually are likely isn’t some cog in the wheel of capitalism that performs for likes. Who you actually are likely isn’t going to find a sense of belonging in following the masses off the cliff of conformity. No, who you actually are is beyond any definition, label, or identity that you can shrink into a social media bio link.

Neurodivergence and Agency

Also, good luck trying to stifle your multidimensionality if you have ADHD or have healed Trauma and embrace all your parts. We neurodivergent humans tend to be allergic and suffer when we have to pretend to be someone we are not.

For those of us who have worked very hard to recovery from Trauma; Trauma Survivors tend to crave their agency, autonomy, and authenticity - because we had to work for it. These are good things because our soul is a mosaic of parts integrated into the Whole Self.

So why one earth would I teach about authenticity and keep shrinking myself online to appease Meta platforms? Why would I choose to do that with my precious life? Why did I heal all of the things for decades on end to try and make some stranger online like me? Why is wellness being performed online in the first place?

In the season I took off social media, my soul said “No more.” So now instead of spending hours on social media; I have more life force energy to write more for you. I have more energy to create. I have more energy to apply it to the relationships in my life that I want to grow and deepen. And I love that. This is just one of the many ways that authenticity can begin to influence not only our lives; but the lives of others. When we say “No” to things that insult our souls, it creates more room for a “Yes” of who and what is more aligned with who we authentically are.

Cheers, to authenticity!

An Authenticity Practice to Consider: I invite you to begin to live your Authentic Self out loud a little bit more.

  • Notice how you feel on social media and ask your physical body or subtle energy body:

  • “Does this content make my body and spirit expand or contract?”

  • Consider doing a social media cleanse to follow accounts that fit more of who you are authentically becoming

The authenticity in me, sees the authenticity in you,

-Shannon

items.content:
Our True Nature is Authenticity

Conformity is a collective trauma response - generations suppressing their True Nature to survive. Buried under social conditioning and the burdens of individual and ancestral trauma awaits our authenticity. When reaching for more of our authentic nature - it can be very uncomfortable. As so many of us recovering from trauma or living with neurodivergent wiring, we must remember that authenticity once came at a cost — sometimes even our safety.

This is why if we are a Trauma Survivor who is recovering and or are neurodivergent - we must remind ourselves, over and over again, that to be human is to be our authentic selves. This is our True Nature. No matter what the illusions a society trapped in unprocessed Trauma Responses and unexamined social conditioning says.

And being authentic is one of the one of the core characteristics of autism, ADHD, and of having earnestly worked for your trauma recovery. As trauma recovery is much of a recon mission to excavate our Trues Selves, a psyche/soul buried under burdens of trauma.
